website_summaries.verdict: Lifts the same height and width as other brands but for a lower price.
pros: Made of sturdy steel that can hold a drywall sheet of up to 4-by-16 feet
Reaches up to 11 feet high for ceilings
Able to assemble and disassemble easily without tools
cons: The cable needs to be guided to stay on track while winding

customer_reviews.title: False and Misleading Product Description - Do NOT Buy
customer_reviews.text: Drywall hoist arrived today. The product description is false and misleading advertising. The product description states this hoist will lift up to 4' x 16'. The Instruction Manual clearly states on page 2, in two different sections, that the maximum board size is "Max. 4 x 8 ft. I phoned the manufacture (Red Line Professional DryWall Equipment) and Red Line told me that I had to purchase as additional kit to lift larger sizes.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: Cheap And Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Cheap junk that will get you thrown off a commercial site. No inspector would ever allow this thing on a real job site. The metal is so cheap you can bend it with your hands. Mine arrived with the winch support nearly folded in two. The casters do not fit in the holes they're supposed to. Update: I have now been waiting 9 days for my refund. The item was destined to Kentucky, it arrived there in 2 days, and there it sits. I expect someone is avoiding picking it up to avoid having to refund my money. Update #2: After nearly 3 weeks my money was finally refunded.
customer_reviews.author: B. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: Perforned as expected. Its not heavy duty enough to use daily but for homeowner or small cibtractor like me that does little ceiling work it is adequate. Locking mechanism (joke) broke within 1st few hours so arms flop around. (Still locka cable just lock that supposed to hold arms stable busted) Ceiling i had to work on was not flat which caused q few issues. Machine had a tenancy to flex in middle causing me to get out of square. All in all i got what i expected it isnt best but not worst
customer_reviews.author: Travis Judd

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Did a small house with 10 ft ceilings pitched steeply. I like that its 3 large pieces that connect together. Extendable arms are a nice feature and allowed us to overhang 6 ft on a loft. Rubber wheels are nice and did not marr my wifes floor. Usage steps: Lift drywall, tilt sideways and set on top of lift which is lowered all the way. Then get it lined up and crank into place. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: John Morton

customer_reviews.title: Cheap parts and bad construction!
customer_reviews.text: I am professional contractor and wanted a lift to keep from renting one every house we build. I purchased this a few weeks ago and put it together yesterday and used it for the first time on a new build. The ceiling we are installing is 4x8x5/8 sheetrock and we prepared the lift to place the sheet on it. Once my guys put the sheetrock on the lift one of the welds broke on the legs and this lift didn't even last one sheet before it broke! Also the wheel to raise and lower the platform is bent so bad that it hits the cable as you turn the wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Shoot

customer_reviews.title: Professional Sheetrock Hoist
customer_reviews.text: I wish we had this hoist for all of our ceilings and walls. One person can do an entire room in less than a day. It was a lifesaver and we saved a significant amount money on installation costs. I was concerned about some of the reviews, but we found it to be very sturdy, heavy duty, and very easy to assemble. I would recommend this for anyone planning on putting sheetrock on ceilings or walls.
customer_reviews.author: R. T

customer_reviews.title: seems to lift drywall
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous because of some of the reviews about this product but it arrived fast, it was easy to put together and it will easily lift a sheet of drywall to the ceiling and hold it while it is being screwed in place. I've been using it with 12 foot 1/2 inch sheets and it works great. Beats the heck out of holding the sheet on top of my head while my wife complains and stuggles with the other end! The fit and finish is not perfect but it was a drywall lift for $180ish dollars. It lifts drywall and it does that well, thats all I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: this is not well built, i was very nervous using it
customer_reviews.text: this is very cheaply made, not well built, i would be ashamed of this if i made it. However it works, have used it on several jobs and it is the price of a rental so it has paid for itself, i use it maybe 2 or 3 times a year, would not recommend this one for daily use but great for lite use just be careful
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lift  -  saves your back.
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional contractor with 20+ yrs of experience in the remodeling/construction business. This lift worked as well as other much more expensive lifts I've used in the past. The only negative is that the arms, when fully extended for use with 12' board, tend to sag a bit more. The issue with the cable causing the lift to drop while raising a board is avoidable if you pay attention to the cable while raising/lowering the lift. I used my hand to guide it so it wouldn't stack on itself while raising and had no problem whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: John Powell

customer_reviews.title: Saves a lot of time
customer_reviews.text: Oh man this thing is awesome. I was building my office, and I just didn't have time during the day to have friends and family come over to help. So I was able to do all of the Sheetrock with this, but it would definitely be helpful even with several people. With the Sheetrock on top of the system, it has plenty of "give" to handle the sheet hanging on one side (like grabbing underneath an electrical box or wire on the way up), so you just maneuver it a bit to unhang and keep on going up. It's also very easy to roll around, and every component swivels 360 degrees, plus there's a brake system for the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrel!!

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Did the job. Proved useful for other things as well.
customer_reviews.text: Used to install 4x10 drywall sheets on a 10 foot ceiling by myself. Could not possibly have done this otherwise. Assembled easily. Worked well. Nice price. Before doing the drywall, needed a way to get bundles of rock wool insulation into the attic. Tried doing this on a ladder. Wasn't happening. Thought of putting a piece of plywood on this and then raising the insulation bundle on that. Worked like a charm. After that, needed to put up the vapour barrier. Found this useful here as well in helping hold up the 6 mil plastic while fastening it in place. Bought it for one purpose. Found it very useful for two more.
customer_reviews.author: JohnV

customer_reviews.title: Save hours and hours of back breaking work
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I drywalled an entire 1500sf home, including a circular vaulted ceiling with this device. Well worth several times what we paid for it. The only draw back to it is there are no bearings or bushings incorporated in the pulley system. Before we realized what was happening, one of the cable pulleys had worn an oblong hole in the frame and caused the device to drag and crank harder. If you get ahead of the game and keep the pulleys heavily lubed, you should not be bothered by this shortcoming. That's the only reason we did not give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: med1pilot

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased, for the price it's great
customer_reviews.text: Just used it this week for the first time. Very pleased, for the price it's great. The only thing kinda bad is that the cable jumps a little while wheeling it up, I think this is due to the fact that the shaft the cable winds on has no cable guide. I can tell this will wear/fray the cable over time. All together, for the price it has all ready paid for itself and saved my back. I hung a ceiling with 4x8 5/8" by myself.
customer_reviews.author: A. R.

customer_reviews.title: Just felt super unsafe...
customer_reviews.text: Some issues I had: -spring loaded pin to lock arm extentisions, fell right apart. -T-arms fall off even when clicked into place - sheet holders on T arms do not spring forward enough to even use to help load sheet. - rubber ends popped right off when adjusting sheet.
customer_reviews.author: j_rosey

customer_reviews.title: Decent panel lift
customer_reviews.text: Decent drywall and panel lift for the price. Pretty much every one I’ve ever rented operates about the same, this one is no exception. The welding on one of the panel supports popped loose in transit but I reckon that’s probably just from the shippers being a little rough with it. A few min with a grinder and welder fixed it though. Otherwise I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy !
customer_reviews.text: Works great takes a bit of getting used to, goes together easily, instructions poor . Comes apart for storage with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: PHIL

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous poor welds on this lift !
customer_reviews.text: Used it successfully for hanging about 8 sheets. On day 3 (three !) a poorly done weld on one of the leg struts broke off. Fortunately, no damage or injury resulted. You can see that the weld was only barely attached to begin with. Disappointing, and dangerous! Will try to get it welded in town rather than go through trying to find the Red Line Chinese supplier, repackaging, returning, experiencing further project delays, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen O Howard

customer_reviews.title: I should have got this before even I started to work
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes relying on friends and family could be disappointing this little tool put everyone into a shame it was so easy to assemble and it never is so precisely which I was in shock the learning curve is very little and the result is almost beautiful "if you are in to tools"
customer_reviews.author: Aurash@

customer_reviews.title: Saved our backs!
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful! My husband and I had a lot of drywall to replace when we bought our house. It was a foreclosure and there was black mold everywhere. So we had 34 sheets of drywall to replace after we remediated the mold. This thing really pulled my butt out of the fire, I absolutely love this thing. It was worth every penny considering the aggravation it saved us.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well. But a little scary sometimes! very happy I spent the money!
customer_reviews.text: While this lift is not as well made as the american unit it is a direct copy of, it does the job quite well. The sudden drop of the upper cradle (noted in other reviews) as you are raising it takes some getting used to but other than that I am very happy I spent the money. I have now used it to hang approximately 110+ sheets of 4x12 drywall. What a huge labor saver. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Matt N

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great love it so easy to use and more the job go quickly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Solid construction.
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed, heavy, and easy to assemble. Was able to hang two sheets of drywall to my ceiling by myself. I've never hung drywall before and this tool saved me a ton of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Karamanski

customer_reviews.title: VERY CHEAPLY MADE!
customer_reviews.text: 1 OF THE CASTER WHEELS IS BENT ALREADY AND I HAVE ONLY HUNG 10 SHEETS OF 4X8 5/8" ROCK ON THE CEILING AND NOW I AM PAST MY 30 DAY RETURN PERIOD. NOW WHAT? I HAVE A $160 PAPER WEIGHT?????????? MANUFACTURER ARE YOU GOING TO STAND BY THIS AND MAKE IT RIGHT OR WHAT?
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Brown

customer_reviews.title: If you are hanging Sheetrock or anything else for that ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are hanging Sheetrock or anything else for that matter above your head, this product makes it a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Randel Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: The box was a little beat up, but the sticker is the only part that didnt survive. I researched this purchase... Great deal here!
customer_reviews.author: rusty h.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the money. About the same price as renting one for a week I found.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Anyone still using their muscles to hold up ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Anyone still using their muscles to hold up plywood Sheetrock beams etc...... needs one of these and the price is excellent. If it was a little smaller I'd keep one in the trunk of my car..... thx
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great! we were able to drywall over popcorn ceilings with just my husband and I. It made the job fast and manageable. No sore sholders and arms the next day!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I used this to finish 3 rooms (walls and ceiling) and it is a back and time saver. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Weld failure on second sheet lifted. 0 stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drywall lift and the weld holding the brake handle on failed lifting the second sheet. It did fail on and held the sheet up but we had to used a pair of vice grips to release the brake after the handle broke clean off.
customer_reviews.author: Jared T

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use....easy mobility when loaded...crank system is smooth. Best investment I made....wish I would have bought one years ago....would have saved on a lot of unnecessary muscle strain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 12ft sheets no problem
customer_reviews.text: Did 350 sq ft ceiling by my self with 12ft 1/2in no problem. Only issue is the lift arms are a bit high if you are only 5’7.... other than lifting onto the arms initials it was great!
customer_reviews.author: Jracine

customer_reviews.title: cant beat it
customer_reviews.text: Really nice lift for the money. I do small remodel projects and this lift works great. I have used it on several ceiling jobs and have used it to hang upper wall sheets. I used it on 12 foot panels. The best thing about this lift is that it shows up on time and it never complains about holding the panels too long.
customer_reviews.author: wyomingcamper

customer_reviews.title: Great sheetrock lift
customer_reviews.text: It works great, great features. I like it and would recommend it to my friends
customer_reviews.author: Hitman

customer_reviews.title: Casters are poor. Directions are poor
customer_reviews.text: Casters are poor. Directions are poor. Lift is marginal. Very unstable. Poor quality. Wish I had paid more and gotten a better quality lift.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Very good 👍
customer_reviews.text: Set up was so easy works great made ceiling work so fast
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Just started put up OSB in my new garage with 10' ceilings it's working great!
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: one me job
customer_reviews.text: If you just can't get anybody to help you with drywall, this is best Way to go I did wall and ceiling by myself. It work out great.
customer_reviews.author: joedonbakker

customer_reviews.title: It is working well. It did slip one time ...
customer_reviews.text: It is working well. It did slip one time and surprised me but overall I can hang sheet rock on the ceiling by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Ande Acramal

customer_reviews.title: This worked great for putting large sheets of frywall up on the ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for putting large sheets of frywall up on the ceiling. We didn't have to hire it done and just did the ceiling ourselves.
customer_reviews.author: Hilari Hermiller

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Box was opened when delivered. Item's were damage inside box. No photo was taken. Regret purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: drywall jack
customer_reviews.text: This handy gadget can save the backs of two people. I can install 1/2" drywall on the ceiling by myself. The tool is a no-brainer to use.
customer_reviews.author: richard MacMillan

customer_reviews.title: A great investment
customer_reviews.text: We bought this when we were ready to hang wallboard in a new garage studio building. It worked very well, my husband and I were able to do 10' ceilings ourselves. The lift worked very well, we never has any issues with it and were able to use it when we put an addition on the house. We have gotten a lot of use out of it and it still works as well as it did on day one. Being 5'2", it was nice to just be that helping hand to help put a sheet of material on the lift. Highly recommended. Buying cost a fraction of renting and we will sell it when we finish our last project
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Lethal!
customer_reviews.text: I used this less then a month and it broke! It dropped a full 5/8" board of sheetrock on my head and knocked me off my ladder.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Started wearing down after the 10th 1/2", 4'x8' sheet ...
customer_reviews.text: Started wearing down after the 10th 1/2", 4'x8' sheet of drywall! Won't stand up for repeated usage! Cheap, but effective!
customer_reviews.author: Rabbi H

customer_reviews.title: Harbor Freight Quality
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed and built lift system. Pulleys wore out at less than 50 panels
customer_reviews.author: Merle W Craner

customer_reviews.title: Great price and a necessity for doing ceilings.
customer_reviews.text: This sure is a handy tool for BigRich to finish the interior ceilings of our new garage. Couldn't do without it.
customer_reviews.author: BigRich/MrsRich

customer_reviews.title: No Good
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, wobbly POS. Caster broke on the second sheet. Cable binds up when cranking it up.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob S.

customer_reviews.title: Very good investment Dry walled 750 sqft
customer_reviews.text: Very good investment Dry walled 750 sqft. house by my self! Sold it when I was done and it ended up costing me 80.00 over 12 weeks! you cant rent one fore a week for 80.00!
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: RedLine 11' Drywall Lift Jack
customer_reviews.text: Assembly of this lift went well and it goes together and operates just like the ones I would typically rent. The nice thing about this is that I own it so there's no need to hustle like a madman to get the job done. I did have to chase the threads on the lift handle with a die as they were too buggered up to fix with a file. Other than that the lift works flawlessly. It works equally well hanging drywall sheets on walls and ceilings. I would definitely purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: lcar987

customer_reviews.title: Good lift for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good lift for the price. Wheels are a little tight but should loosen up. The cable does slip a little on its way up but is not a danger to anything. Does the same job as the expensive ones
customer_reviews.author: bigcat 75

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Weld job was bad machine broke thank god no one got hurt or it would of been a law suit. And shall i add on it didnt even last me a week. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus and Zully

customer_reviews.title: Drywall lift.
customer_reviews.text: i wasnt looking for quality when looking for a lift. I was just looking for a decent one for a decent price. I was not going to drywall a whole house resting sheets of drywall on my head again. I came upon this product and figured it would do the job. It performed well for the quality. Little unstable fully extended. Cable jumps alot but i was impressed for how much i paid. It paid itself off already. better than buying an exspensive one and have it sit around for another job.
customer_reviews.author: MADTRAPPER

customer_reviews.title: Heavy man
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine, Very heavy duty, not flimsy at all.
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: must have for drywall work
customer_reviews.text: My sons house burned and he had to rebuild. This tool made the most impossible job easily done in no time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in gold!
customer_reviews.text: I had a 360 sqft addition that we we're building and I took on the sheetrock hanging part to save some money. All of the sheets were 4x12x1/2". I also looked into renting a lift for a week which would've cost $130 (+tax). For the price of this lift, I decided to buy it. The hardest part of the job was lifting the sheets onto the lift, after that, hanging them both on the ceiling and walls was a breeze! Assembling it was really easy too, it was completely assembled, just broken down into three pieces and folded up. I would definitely recommend this lift!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but don't expect it to be trouble free at this price!
customer_reviews.text: This lift has done the job we needed it for, but required some fairly creative assembly to overcome some weaknesses in the design. The price was right and we knew from previous reviews that there would be some problems, but don't buy this if you aren't a pretty talented DIY person who is used to overcoming problems. Handling a 4x8 piece of sheetrock plus this lift is still a challenge, but it is possible for one person to put sheetrock on a ceiling with this lift.
customer_reviews.author: sasanqua

customer_reviews.title: A good buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is just like the one I've been renting from my local store. And half the price of the Depot.
customer_reviews.author: salverez

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. I used it on one residential job so far. Easy to assemble and disassemble. Gave it 4 stars because you do have to lightly oil the cable/ gears as described by another review I read otherwise it squeaks/ screeches when cranking up
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product from a Great Seller
customer_reviews.text: Just received the drywall lift and it's in perfect condition, both with the way it looks and the way it works. Just ordered it Sunday night and the cost of shipping had been under-estimated by amz. With that complication the seller was willing to hand deliver it from MD to Philadelphia PA. Seller undersold the perfect condition and quality of the product and I would encourage buying from this seller again and again!!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Butkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the box and used it yesterday (Nov 4) for the first time. Has a bit of a hiccup as it's lifting the panel but works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: dry wall hoist
customer_reviews.text: This product was a godsend when i installed ceilings in a house i was remmodeling. one person can do it, though two is better.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: lift
customer_reviews.text: i would reccomend this lift to any one to lift dry wall up with out breaking your back with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Should have bought this year's ago
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Should have bought this year's ago. Never do a ceiling again without it!
customer_reviews.author: JadenB

customer_reviews.title: sweet tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Only issue is when cable slips as it only reels in one spot so it builds up and falls slightly when it slips off but you get use to it. Otherwise great tool! Saves your back and don't need another person sweet
customer_reviews.author: Corey Sweitzer

customer_reviews.title: back saver
customer_reviews.text: bought this for the addition Im building onto my house. works well, except for the cable jump on its way back up with a sheet on it; had to take a star off for making me pee a little the first time it happened.
customer_reviews.author: BG Skold

customer_reviews.title: All good
customer_reviews.text: Before buying the Red Line Drywall Lift I read reviews of several lifts. The Red Line reviews were positive and consequently so was my experience. I received the lift within a week of ordering it. It was easy to assemble. It worked very well and after my project was over it broke down easily for space saving storage.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Saves your back!
customer_reviews.text: This lift was cheap but works great. It really saved our backs. I will get lots of use out of this lift.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Jeffries

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This lift is awesome. Makes my life easier and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: As noted in other reviews the "clunk" at one point as it lifts takes a little getting use to but it is a great tool. I would recomend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: B Green

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to spend over $600 for a unit, so I spent less than $200 & after the first drywall that I wanted to lift I asked to return it. As I had a time constraint, I managed to use it. I should have gone with the review that stated that as you lifted the unit would drop as the cable slips over itself. If you have a small room or a basement that you are finishing you can manage with it. Just make sure that as you are lifting you watch that the cable is not climbing over itself. That is what makes the cable than jump off & the unit slips down.
customer_reviews.author: MDD

customer_reviews.title: Quick ship
customer_reviews.text: Recieved it a couple days after I purchased it. Box was a little banged up and some Knicks, but it's a tool that was going to get those anyway. Only used it for the ceiling so far, but very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Very great tool for one man job n easy to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Very great tool for one man job n easy to use n easy assembly n disassembly after job done!
customer_reviews.author: Phong V.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected and at a price no one could argue with.
customer_reviews.author: brian cain

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Black rubber tips keep dropping off. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel E. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Red Line Drywall Lift
customer_reviews.text: Surprised by the excellent quality of this drywall lift. Very easy to put together. Very easy to use. I installed 5/8" X 48" X 12' drywall by myself using this lift.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Strothmann

customer_reviews.title: Glad we bought it!
customer_reviews.text: This tool did everything we hoped for. It was easy to assemble and easy to use. It made quick work of getting drywall up on the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: Definitely beats hiring an extra person to help you do the job. Doesn't talk back and goes aas long as you do.
customer_reviews.author: Victorious1027

customer_reviews.title: Cable Winding Issues
customer_reviews.text: The lift works ok, but when raising up the panel the lift cable would roll up on top of itself on the drum. Then all of the sudden the cable slips off the cable below. The excess cable slack then makes the panel "jump" down like it is going to fall.
customer_reviews.author: K. Romzek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This product is very sturdy and is very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Ford

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and very reasonable price. Breaks down to three easily moved sections, easily carried by an average adult. Easy assembly/disassembly when on the job. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: mrf1x1t

customer_reviews.title: great item for the work involved
customer_reviews.text: the lift works great easy to use but the issue i have is it was a used or a returned item. and for the cost should have been new
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after using a friends. Makes hanging ceilings a breeze. Wheels are cheap but everything else is metal. Definitely gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Paully

customer_reviews.title: really bad
customer_reviews.text: after second use the wheel get bent never work again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Red Line Professional 11-Foot Drywall Lift Panel Hoist Jack
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Red Line Professional 11-Foot Drywall Lift Panel Hoist Jack
feature_bullets: Tilts 65° laterally for easy loading and for installation on sloped ceilings
Get sheets in place and mounted in a fraction of the time

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars142 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
